decks.notes: The key strategy of this Aggro Dragon Stompy deck in Legacy is to disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also deploying powerful creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate its game plan. Additionally, cards like Chalice of the Void and Sundering Eruption help control the board and deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overpower the opponent and close out the game before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer while also ramping into powerful threats with cards like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple. It also has some control elements with cards like Blast Zone and Wasteland to deal with opposing threats. The deck's goal is to establish board presence and close out the game quickly through efficient beatdown strategies.

The deck focuses on using cheap, efficient spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Delver of Secrets to set up its draws and generate card advantage, while also running a package of countermagic in the form of Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly and efficiently closing out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, it aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game. It also utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. The deck's creatures, such as Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf, provide a clock for the opponent while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Brazen Borrower offers versatility. The mana base ensures consistency and the inclusion of Wasteland helps disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on using lands to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It uses cards like Crop Rotation, Wasteland, and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base while also utilizing powerful lands like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create win conditions. Cards like Life from the Loam and Crucible of Worlds ensure a steady stream of lands, while Sphere of Resistance and Maze of Ith provide additional control elements. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through land-based synergies and disruption.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield by using cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. This combo-based strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats early in the game, while also having protection from counterspells with cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also utilizes cards like Omniscience and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to provide additional synergy and card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on cheating out big creatures and outpacing the opponent's defenses.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brazen Borrower, then bring them back to the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The inclusion of Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Archon of Cruelty provides strong reanimated threats, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast reanimated creatures and powerful board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently combo off by utilizing spells to mill through your deck and ultimately win the game with cards like Thassa's Oracle or Fell the Profane. The deck aims to generate mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal, Simian Spirit Guide, and Dark Ritual, while also utilizing graveyard recursion with cards like Dread Return and Narcomoeba. Cabal Therapy is used for disruption and to further enable the combo, while Pact of Negation helps protect the combo from disruption. The deck aims to win the game as fast as possible by executing its combo effectively.

The primary objective of this deck is to quickly assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo to win the game. By using cards like Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Shuko, the deck is able to quickly mill cards from the library and use Narcomoeba as an additional win condition. Force of Will and Daze provide protection, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for key combo pieces. Urza's Saga can help find important artifacts, while Meticulous Archive can help reuse important spells. The deck aims to win the game by either milling the opponent out or using Thassa's Oracle to win instantly.
